entry.value:
import org.apache.nifi.processor.io.OutputStreamCallback import java.nio.charset.StandardCharsets
def flowFile = session.get() if(!flowFile) return
def baseUrlDatePart = "https://data.electricitymaps.com/2025-04-03" def suffix = "_hourly.csv" def zones = [ "IT-CNO", "IT-CSO", "IT-NO", "IT-SAR", "IT-SIC", "IT-SO", "SE-SE1", "SE-SE2", "SE-SE3", "SE-SE4" ] def years = ["2024", "2023", "2022", "2021"]
zones.each { zone -> years.each { year -> def filenamePart = "${zone}_${year}${suffix}" def downloadUrl = "${baseUrlDatePart}/${filenamePart}"
def newFlowFile = session.create(flowFile) newFlowFile = session.putAttribute(newFlowFile, "download.url", downloadUrl) newFlowFile = session.putAttribute(newFlowFile, "data.zone", zone) newFlowFile = session.putAttribute(newFlowFile, "data.year", year) newFlowFile = session.putAttribute(newFlowFile, "filename", filenamePart)
newFlowFile = session.write(newFlowFile, { outputStream -> outputStream.write(downloadUrl.getBytes(StandardCharsets.UTF_8)) } as OutputStreamCallback)
session.transfer(newFlowFile, ScriptingComponentUtils.REL_SUCCESS) } } session.remove(flowFile)
SELECT "Datetime (UTC)", "Country", "Zone name", "Zone id", "Carbon intensity gCOâ‚‚eq/kWh (direct)", "Carbon-free energy percentage (CFE%)" FROM FLOWFILE

entry.key: Max Length To Put In Attribute
